title: scgpt_integration_knn
description: Cell type annotation workflow that performs scGPT integration of reference and query dataset followed by KNN label transfer.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. The query data in
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. The query data in .h5mu format with predicted labels predicted from the classifier trained on the reference.

output_obs_predictions.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. In which `
output_obs_predictions.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. In which `.obs` slots to store the predicted information.
If provided, must have the same length as `--reference_obs_targets`.
If empty, will default to the `reference_obs_targets` combined with the `"_pred"` suffix.

output_obs_probability.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. In which `
output_obs_probability.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. In which `.obs` slots to store the probability of the predictions.
If provided, must have the same length as `--reference_obs_targets`.
If empty, will default to the `reference_obs_targets` combined with the `"_probability"` suffix.

output_obsm_integrated.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_integrated_scgpt`. In which .obsm slot to store the integrated embedding.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object
output_compression.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression format to be used on the output h5mu object.

id.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample
id.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input dataset consisting of the (unlabeled) query observations
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. Input dataset consisting of the (unlabeled) query observations. The dataset is expected to be pre-processed in the same way as --reference.

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to process. Should match the modality of the --reference dataset.

input_layer.description: Type: `string`. The layer of the input dataset to process if
input_layer.help_text: Type: `string`. The layer of the input dataset to process if .X is not to be used. Should contain log normalized counts.

input_var_gene_names.help_text: Type: `string`. The .var field in the input (query) dataset containing gene names; if not provided, the .var index will be used.

input_obs_batch_label.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `sample`. The .obs field in the input (query) dataset containing the batch labels.

overwrite_existing_key.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If provided, will overwrite existing fields in the input dataset when data are copied during the reference alignment process
overwrite_existing_key.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. If provided, will overwrite existing fields in the input dataset when data are copied during the reference alignment process.

reference.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `reference.h5mu`. Reference dataset consisting of observations with cell type labels present in the
reference.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `reference.h5mu`. Reference dataset consisting of observations with cell type labels present in the .obs --reference_obs_batch_label column to train the classifier on. The dataset is expected to be pre-processed in the same way as the --input query dataset(s).

reference_obs_targets.description: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `ann_level_1;ann_level_2;ann_level_3;ann_level_4;ann_level_5;ann_finest_level`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The `
reference_obs_targets.help_text: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `ann_level_1;ann_level_2;ann_level_3;ann_level_4;ann_level_5;ann_finest_level`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The `.obs` key(s) of the target labels to tranfer.

reference_var_gene_names.help_text: Type: `string`. The .var field in the reference dataset containing gene names; if not provided, the .var index will be used.

reference_obs_batch_label.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `sample`. The .obs field in the reference dataset containing the batch labels.

model.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `resources_test/scgpt/best_model.pt`. The scGPT model file
model.help_text:
Type: `file`, required, example: `resources_test/scgpt/best_model.pt`. The scGPT model file.
Can either be a foundation model or a fine-tuned model. 
If the model file is a fine-tuned model, it must contain a key for the checkpoints (--finetuned_checkpoints_key).

model_vocab.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `resources_test/scgpt/vocab.json`. The scGPT model vocabulary file
model_vocab.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `resources_test/scgpt/vocab.json`. The scGPT model vocabulary file.

model_config.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `args.json`. The scGPT model configuration file
model_config.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `args.json`. The scGPT model configuration file.

finetuned_checkpoints_key.description: Type: `string`, example: `model_state_dict`. Key in the model file containing the pretrained checkpoints
finetuned_checkpoints_key.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `model_state_dict`. Key in the model file containing the pretrained checkpoints. Must be provided when `--model` is a fine-tuned model.

pad_token.description: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. Token used for padding
pad_token.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. Token used for padding.

pad_value.description: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding token
pad_value.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value of the padding token.

n_hvg.description: Type: `integer`, default: `1200`. Number of highly variable genes to subset for
n_hvg.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `1200`. Number of highly variable genes to subset for.

max_seq_len.description: Type: `integer`. The maximum sequence length of the tokenized data
max_seq_len.help_text: Type: `integer`. The maximum sequence length of the tokenized data. Defaults to the number of features if not provided.

dsbn.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Apply domain-specific batch normalization
dsbn.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Apply domain-specific batch normalization

batch_size.description: Type: `integer`, default: `64`. The batch size to be used for embedding inference
batch_size.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `64`. The batch size to be used for embedding inference.

n_input_bins.description: Type: `integer`, default: `51`. The number of bins to discretize the data into; When no value is provided, data won't be binned
n_input_bins.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `51`. The number of bins to discretize the data into; When no value is provided, data won't be binned.

seed.description: Type: `integer`. Seed for random number generation used for binning
seed.help_text: Type: `integer`. Seed for random number generation used for binning. If not set, no seed is used.

leiden_resolution.description: Type: List of `double`, default: `1.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Control the coarseness of the clustering
leiden_resolution.help_text: Type: List of `double`, default: `1.0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Control the coarseness of the clustering. Higher values lead to more clusters.

weights.description: Type: `string`, default: `uniform`, choices: ``uniform`, `distance`, `gaussian``. Weight function used in prediction
weights.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `uniform`, choices: ``uniform`, `distance`, `gaussian``. Weight function used in prediction. Possible values are:
`uniform` (all points in each neighborhood are weighted equally) or 
`distance` (weight points by the inverse of their distance)

n_neighbors.description: Type: `integer`, default: `15`. The number of neighbors to use in k-neighbor graph structure used for fast approximate nearest neighbor search with PyNNDescent
n_neighbors.help_text:
Type: `integer`, default: `15`. The number of neighbors to use in k-neighbor graph structure used for fast approximate nearest neighbor search with PyNNDescent. 
Larger values will result in more accurate search results at the cost of computation time.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
